creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: carp swimming vertically up a waterfall at top; second carp at bottom attempting to jump out of water amid choppy waves
markings: LLC red artist\'s seals: 来章 {Raishō}; 春分斎 {Shunbunsai}
signed: LLC: 慶應戊辰仲秋　来章筆 {Keiō boshin chūshū Raishō hitsu] (Fourth year of Keiō, 8th lunar month, painted by Raishō)
text: One carp emerges vertically from splashing waves at the center of the bottom of the piece. A second is obscured but visible leaping perfectly vertically behind falling water at the top center. Black ink streaks suggest the falling water. The back/dorsal side of the fish, two eyes, and fins are symmetrically centered and viewed from the top.
title: Leaping Carp
